name: Fast Pace
description: A hurried travel pace that prioritizes speed over awareness and stealth. Characters move quickly, focusing on covering as much ground as possible while paying less attention to their surroundings. This pace is used when time is of the essence and the risks of moving quickly are acceptable.

mechanicalEffects: Imposes Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception or Survival) checks
Covers 33% more distance than Normal pace
Increases risk of missing important details or threats
Makes the party more noticeable and easier to detect

restrictions: Cannot be used if terrain limits maximum pace to Slow or Normal
Requires good roads to increase pace from Normal to Fast in some terrains
Arctic terrain requires appropriate equipment (such as skis) to maintain Fast pace
Mounts can move at twice the listed distance for 1 hour, after which they need a Short or Long Rest before they can move at that increased pace again
Characters flying or with special movement that ignores Difficult Terrain can move at Fast pace regardless of terrain

terrain.note: Many terrain types do not allow Fast pace without good roads (see Travel Terrain table)
terrain.difficultTerrain: Difficult Terrain halves movement speed, which typically prevents Fast pace
terrain.roads: Good roads can enable Fast pace in terrain that normally allows only Normal pace
terrain.flying: Flying characters or those who ignore Difficult Terrain can use Fast pace regardless of terrain below

calculations.specialMovement: For creatures with magical speed, use: Miles per day (Normal) × 1⅓ = Fast pace miles per day (round down)

examples: Racing to reach a destination before a deadline
Fleeing from pursuers over long distances
Traveling on well-maintained roads when speed is critical
Flying characters moving quickly through open air
Urgent delivery missions or time-sensitive quests
Trying to catch up to someone who left earlier

foundryVTT.automation: Calculates faster travel times with automatic disadvantage tracking
foundryVTT.tracking: Tracks journey progress at increased speed
foundryVTT.skillChecks: Automatically applies Disadvantage to Perception, Survival, and Stealth checks
foundryVTT.journalEntries: Records urgent travel segments in adventure logs
foundryVTT.warnings: Can alert GM/players about reduced awareness penalties

notes.tradeoff: Speed comes at the cost of awareness and stealth - the party is much more likely to miss clues, walk into ambushes, or be detected
notes.tactical: Generally not recommended in dangerous areas unless time pressure justifies the risks
notes.fatigue: While Fast pace itself doesn't cause exhaustion, it's often combined with extended travel which does
notes.detection: The party makes more noise and is less careful, making them easier to spot or hear
